coredata.dc:title: The self-consistent determination of ion-pair distribution functions within the Debye-Hückel framework
coredata.dc:creator: Cooper, I.L.
Harrison, J.A.
coredata.dc:description:
Abstract
Pair distribution functions for like ions in an electrolyte are generally predicted by the traditional Debye-Hückel model to be unphysical, becoming negative at small separations from the reference ion. A simple modification to the Debye-Hückel model is proposed which corrects this unphysical behaviour while retaining both the linearity and overall charge neutrality of the model.

UK Received 6 June 1984; in final form 20 August 1984 Pair distribution functions for like ions in an electrolyte are generally predicted by the traditional Debye Huckel model to be unphysical, becoming negative at small separations from the reference ion. A simple modification to the Debye-Hiickel model is proposed which corrects this unphysical behaviour while retaining both the linearity and overall charge neutrality of the model. 1- Introduction The traditional Debye Huckel approach [1] to tlie ion distributions in an electrolyte continues to gen- erate refinements and extensions [2,3], and recent ex- perimental and theoretical work on the structure of electrolytes [4] places considerable emphasis on the role of ion-pair distribution functions (a physically motivated account is given by Anderson [5]). It has long been known that the Debye Huckel model gen- erally predicts negative values for the pair distribution function for like ions in an electrolyte at small separa- tions from the reference ion. Thus, the Debye Huckel model is unable to provide a simple first approxima- tion to such distribution functions, and cannot contri- bute meaningfully to any comparison of predicted ion distribution functions at differing levels of approxi- mation. A more realistic treatment of the ion-pair dis- tribution functions would enable the model to be placed in its proper perspective m relation to the re- sults of experiments [4], more sophisticated theoreti- cal treatments [2,6] and computer simulation studies [7,8]. Further, although the Debye-Huckel model is noted for its overall charge neutrality (the zeroth mo- ment condition), it would appear that this charge neu- trality itself is somewhat artifical, since it is achieved only by the removal of an excessive amount of charge (in the form of ions of like sign) from the vicinity of 0 009-2614/84/S 03.00 Eisevier Science Publishers B.V. (North-Holland Physics Publishing Division) the reference ion. Any improvement in the ion-pair distribution functions should properly be achieved within the context of overall charge neutrality, since the correct ion-pair distribution functions must reflect the electrical neutrality of the solution. The objective of this note is to demonstrate that the above noted deficiency in the ion-pair distribution function for like ions predicted by the traditional Debye Huckel model can be rectified in a simple manner, while retaining the constraint of overall charge neutrality and maintaining a linear relation be- tween charge and potential. The relevant theory is outlined in section 2, and the paper concludes with a discussion of results, together with comparisons with other treatments. 2.
